meanings.definition: A garment worn by women in ancient Greece, typically a long, sleeveless tunic.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, women wore a peplos as their traditional attire.
meanings.sent2: She looked elegant in her flowing peplos at the Greek-themed party.
meanings.sent3: The museum curator accidentally put on a peplos instead of a modern dress, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her peplos was a symbol of her connection to the ancient world.
meanings.sent5: The peplos fluttered in the breeze, reminiscent of ancient times.

meanings.definition: A type of dress or gown resembling the ancient Greek peplos.
meanings.sent1: The designer created a modern peplos inspired by ancient Greek fashion.
meanings.sent2: The bridesmaids looked stunning in their colorful peplos dresses.
meanings.sent3: The fashion show featured a futuristic twist on the classic peplos.
meanings.sent4: Her peplos gown flowed like a river of fabric as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The peplos dress hugged her figure gracefully, accentuating her beauty.

meanings.definition: To dress or clothe oneself in a peplos.
meanings.sent1: She decided to peplos herself for the historical reenactment event.
meanings.sent2: The actress had to peplos quickly before going on stage.
meanings.sent3: He tried to peplos in a hurry but ended up tangled in the fabric.
meanings.sent4: The model elegantly peplosed in the latest designer peplos.
meanings.sent5: As she peplosed, she felt a connection to the ancient women of Greece.
